Detailed Description

The engine that interfaces with the emerge program.

Author:
Alessandro Diaferia

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum PortageEngine::Action

defines the current action

Enumerator:
NoAction  the engine is performing no action.
Pretend  the engine is asking emerge for pretending packages.
Install  the engine is using emerge to install packages.

Member Function Documentation

PortageEngine::Action PortageEngine::currentAction (  ) 

the action currently performing.

void PortageEngine::deRef (  )  [protected, slot]

This slot is called to update references count and eventually destroy the engine when no app uses it anymore.

void PortageEngine::error ( const QString &  title,
const QString &  body,
const QString &  details 
) [signal]

This signal is emitted whenever an error occurs.

Parameters:
details might be empty,
title always valid.
body always valid.

void PortageEngine::finished (  )  [signal]

This signal is emitted whenever the last action performing finishes.

PortageEngine * PortageEngine::instance (  )  [static]

The instance of the engine. Use this to retrieve a pointer to the engine.

QList< Package * > PortageEngine::packages (  ) 

the current packages resulting from the last Portage interrogation or an empty list if no interrogation occurred.

void PortageEngine::pretend ( const QStringList &  atoms  ) 

Performs a pretend action using emerge.

Parameters:
atoms are the package atoms to be pretended.
